SENT.plain: Deferasirox is an orally administered, once-daily iron chelator with a generally good safety and efficacy profile
Reported adverse events in the older myelodysplastic population are somewhat different to the more intensively investigated and younger thalassaemic population
Renal impairment is the most concerning adverse event, but this is reversible if identified and the drug is withdrawn early
Gastrointestinal effects, particularly diarrhoea, can be troublesome for older patients, but can be minimized with tailored therapy

Negative iron balance can be achieved in most patients with a median dose of 20 mg/kg/day, and doses up to 40 mg/kg are possible in patients with severe iron overload, who are at risk of cardiac decompensation
